title: What if Sol's passive was invisible from bush until it hit an enemy?
body:
I mean, Riot said that he was pretty good in the jungle, but being unable to sneak around in bushes really hurts this play style, as well as roaming in general. If nunu ult and other abilities can be invisible in bushes, Aurelion Sol should be treated similarly right?

Having it be invisible until it damages a champion seems pretty fair, and would immediately communicate what was happening to the opponent to avoid the legendary 5 sunfire evelynn experience.

replies.body: Not sure this has been addressed yet, but Sol's passive should work just like Sunfire Cape's passive, Immolate. I believe that the passive only affects those within the bush, but not those outside. It would be tough to pull off visually, but it's better than ruining the game for Sol players.
Considering that the radius is large enough to where it would be extremely difficult to hit a champ that was occupying the same bush as Sol, I doubt this would be an effective solution

Or the passive could disable all-together while in a bush, but this could be potentially harming to the playstyle. Using Sol's W while in a bush, however, will reveal him to the enemy team if they have vision in that area outside of the bush.
This is definitely a harm, and would feel very awkward in practice
